accepted_findings.reason: We use the correct format 'no-new-privileges=true' (with =). The scanner incorrectly expects 'no-new-privileges:true' (with :). This is a false positive.
Google APIs (apis.google.com, accounts.google.com) do not support integrity attributes as they are dynamically generated scripts. This is a known limitation and not a security issue.

We explicitly set all security headers in location blocks to prevent overwriting. All security headers (X-Frame-Options, X-XSS-Protection, etc.) are explicitly set in each location block, so they are not being overwritten. This is the correct approach when you need location-specific headers like Cache-Control.
